item.title: Choose your own research-software adventure
item.description: CW22 - 2022-04-04 Collaborative Ideas session group: J-Juniper Participants Chris Jochem, University of Southampton, w.c.jochem@soton.ac.uk Achintya Rao, The Alan Turing Institute, arao@turing.ac.uk Collaborative Idea Title Choose your own research-software adventure Context / Research Domain Social scientists don’t typically code (there are exceptions!) and most that rely on software for their research use proprietary tools they are taught to use at university. While the long-term availability of the software may be “sustainable” because of commercial licences providing support, the individual researcher may not be able to access their own work after leaving the setting that offered them free licences for the tool in question.
